1099: speaker
bg
portraits
msg
Guys, we now know more about the bugs. From the transmitting substances inside the larvae, we know that the bugs can use the substances to communicate.
各位，关于虫子的研究有进展了。从那些幼虫的体内有某种类似信息素的东西来看，它们可以依靠这些信息素互相确认指令进行活动。
みんな、虫の研究に進展があったわ。あの幼虫の体内には、ある種のフェロモンのようなものがあるの。このフェロモンで互いに指令を確認しあいながら行動してるみたい。
다들, 벌레 연구에 진전이 있었어. 그 애벌레의 체내에는 어떤 종류의 페로몬 같은 게 있어. 이 페로몬으로 서로 명령을 확인하면서 행동하는 것 같아.

Folks, there's been progress in the research on worms. From the fact that those larvae have something like pheromones in their bodies, they can rely on those pheromones to confirm instructions to each other for their activities.
Hey guys, I've made some progress on my bug research. The larvae have some kind of pheromone inside their bodies. It seems that they use these pheromones to confirm each other's commands.
msg

Although they are Houkai creatures, they've developed some organism's features, which is intriguing. Maybe we should take into account their values as organisms, instead of treating them merely as Houkai creatures.
虽然是崩坏生物，但是却进化出了类似生物的机能，这点还是非常令人感兴趣的，或许我们应该考虑崩坏生物作为生命体的价值，而不是把它们当做纯粹的崩坏造物来看待。
崩壊生物だけど、元来の生物に似たメカニズムを得るまで進化してる。これはとても興味深いわ。もしかしたら、私たちは崩壊生物を崩壊の造物としてではなく、純粋な生命体として認識する必要があるのかもしれない。
붕괴 생물이지만, 원래의 생물과 비슷한 메커니즘을 얻을 때까지 진화하고 있어. 이건 정말 흥미로워. 어쩌면 우리는 붕괴 생물을 붕괴의 피조물이 아니라 순수한 생명체로 인식해야 할지도 몰라.

Although it is a collapsed creature, but has evolved a creature-like function, this is still very interesting, perhaps we should consider the value of collapsed creatures as living beings, rather than treating them as purely collapsed creatures.

It's a decaying organism, but it's evolved to the point where it's getting mechanisms similar to the original organism. This is very interesting. Perhaps we need to recognize disintegrating organisms as pure life forms, rather than as the product of disintegration.
portraits
msg
If the Houkai creatures are able to evolve into some animals on Earth, that means a chapter of evolution, and humans will inevitably go extinct.
如果说崩坏生物在进化的过程中能够转换替代地球的生物生态，那么或许这个世界就完成了一次真正意义上的革新，人类被历史淘汰也是自然进化的必然。
もし、崩壊生物が進化の過程で地球の生物生体と取って変わることができるようになれば、この世界は本当の意味での革新を成し遂げることになる。人類が歴史に淘汰されるのも自然の進化の必然ということね。
만약 붕괴 생물이 진화 과정에서 지구의 생물 생태계를 대체할 수 있게 된다면, 이 세상은 진정한 의미의 혁신을 이룰 거야. 인류가 역사에서 도태되는 것도 자연의 진화의 필연이겠죠.

If the collapsed creatures in the process of evolution can be converted to replace the biological ecology of the Earth, then perhaps the world has completed a real sense of innovation, human beings are eliminated by history is also the natural evolution of the inevitable.

If the collapsing organisms are able to replace the living organisms of the earth in the course of evolution, this world will have achieved a real revolution. So it is a natural evolutionary inevitability that humanity will be eliminated by history.

I extracted the transmitting substances from the larvae and made a basic tracker from what I have. We now can use the transmitting substances to track down where the castle is.
我把幼虫体内的信息素样本提取了出来，并用手头的材料制作了一个简易的追踪器，这次我们不用被动地寻找巢穴的位置了，可以利用城堡内幼虫散播的信息素来进行追踪。
幼虫の体内のフェロモンサンプルを抽出して、手元にある材料で簡単な追跡装置を作ったの。今回は受け身的に巣の位置を探さなくても大丈夫。城の幼虫が撒いたフェロモンを利用して追跡できる。
애벌레 체내의 페로몬 샘플을 추출해서, 손에 있는 재료로 간단한 추적 장치를 만들었어. 이번에는 수동적으로 둥지 위치를 찾지 않아도 돼. 성의 애벌레가 뿌린 페로몬을 이용해 추적할 수 있어.

I extracted the pheromone samples from the larvae and made a simple tracker with the materials on hand. This time, instead of passively searching for the location of the nest, we can use the pheromones dispersed by the larvae inside the castle to track.

I extracted a pheromone sample from the larva's body and made a simple tracking device out of materials I had on hand. This time we don't have to passively locate the nest. We can use the pheromones released by the larvae in the castle to track them.

msg
The larvae in the lab only transmit simple messages, like how we say “go back home”.
之前在实验室里的幼体，它们释放的信息素只有一种简单的讯号，如果用语言来做比喻的话就是“回家”这个信号。
実験室の中のは幼体だった。彼らの放つフェロモンは一種の簡単な信号だけ。言葉で例えるなら「帰る」という信号のみ。
실험실 안에 있던 건 유체였어. 그들이 내뿜는 페로몬은 일종의 간단한 신호뿐이야. 말로 예를 들면 「돌아가」라는 신호만.
The pheromones released by the hatchlings in the lab were a simple signal, a verbal analogy of "go home".
The ones in the laboratory were juveniles. The only pheromone they emitted was a kind of simple signal. To use a verbal analogy, the only signal they gave was "I'm leaving.
msg

As they were confined, their mind only stayed at the stage of “go back home”. So, when their command of “go back home” is satisfied, the transmitting substances will change into something like “knock the door”.
因为它们被拘禁了起来，所以思维只停留在“回家”这个阶段，而当它们满足了回家的命令后，信息素就会改变性状变成“敲门”之类后续的动作信号。
彼らは閉じこめられているから、思考が「帰る」という段階で停まってるの。そして帰る命令がクリアされると、フェロモンの性質が変化して「ドアをノックする」のような次の動作の信号になる。
그들은 갇혀 있으니까, 사고가 「돌아가」라는 단계에서 멈춰 있는 거야. 그리고 돌아가라는 명령이 클리어되면, 페로몬의 성질이 변화해서 「문을 노크한다」 같은 다음 동작의 신호가 되는 거지.

Because they are confined, they think only at the stage of "go home", and when they satisfy the command to go home, the pheromones will change their traits to "knock" and other subsequent action signals.
They are locked in, so their thinking stops at the "leave" stage. And when the order to leave is cleared, the nature of the pheromone changes to signal the next action, like "knocking on the door".
msg
We're only tracing the first stage, that's why we lost the target as it changes into the second stage.
也就是说我们的追踪点只停留在了第一个阶段，而无法搜索到第二阶段的信号，所以就造成了中断。
つまり、私たちの追跡装置は第1段階に留まっていて、第2段階の信号を捜索できないの。だから切れてしまったんだわ。
즉, 우리의 추적 장치는 제1단계에 머물러 있고, 제2단계의 신호를 수색할 수 없는 거야. 그래서 끊어진 거란 말이지.
This means that our tracking point only stays in the first stage and cannot search for the signal of the second stage, so it causes an interruption.
That means our tracking device is stuck on phase 1 and can't search for a phase 2 signal. That's why it cut out.
